result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Teddy Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas Teddy Nelson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas Teddy Nelson was found guilty of Possession of THC [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to report to Probation today May 31, 2016.
If Defendant is compliant with Probation Court may discharge after 6 months.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation as determined by the Court.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Continue on current payment plan.
DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Nicholas Teddy Nelson appeared. Case calle dat 8:08. ADA Hartung updates the court, there is an agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 15CM701 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 15CM701. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CM701. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statment. Crt orders: Sentence W/H
1 year probation with conditions:
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment.  
- Random and reqular testing
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00. 

If DE is compliant with probation Court may discharge probation after 6 mo. 
DE eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation as determined by the court.
DE to report today for probation.
Final pre-trial on May 31, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Petros updates the court they have rec'd an offer today. ADA Nieskes responds. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:00 am.
